lines.content: * Clippy is a task management assistant that allows users to manage tasks via a command-line interface.
* The application starts by loading stored tasks and then processes user commands in a loop
* until an exit command is given.
* Represents exceptions specific to the Clippy application.
* This exception is thrown when an invalid operation or input is encountered.
return new ClippyException("Oh no. Please add a description for " + task + " task :(");
return new ClippyException("Oh no. Task " + index + " does not exist :(");
return new ClippyException("Oh no. I do not understand this command :(");
return new ClippyException("Oh no. Please add a time / date to the task :(");
return new ClippyException("Oh no. " + indexStr + " is not a valid integer :(");
* Creates an exception indicating an invalid date/time format.
* This exception is thrown when a user provides a date/time that does not match
* @param input The invalid date/time string provided by the user.
* @return A {@code ClippyException} with a message explaining the correct format.
return new ClippyException("Invalid date/time format: " + input
return new ClippyException("Invalid date format: " + input + ". Expected: DD/MM/YYYY E.g. 01/01/2025 2000");
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Supports adding different tasks such as ToDo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs an AddCommand with that command type and task description.
* @param command The type of command, determining the type of task to add.
* @param item The description of the task to be added.
* Executes the command to add a task to the provided task list.
* Displays a confirmed message to the user.
* @param tasks The task list to which the task should be added.
* @throws ClippyException If the task description is invalid or improperly formatted.
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws ClippyException {
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return false, since adding a task does not terminate the program.
* Represents a command to terminate the program.
* Displays a goodbye message before exiting.
* Executes the command to display a goodbye message.
* @param tasks The task list, which remains unchanged.
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return true, since this command signals the end of the program.
* Represents a command that can be executed within the Clippy application.
* Implementing classes define specific actions to be performed on a task list.
* Represents the different types of commands supported by the Clippy application.
* Each command type corresponds to a specific user action.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* The command removes the task at the specified index and displays a confirmed message.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param indexStr The index of the task to be deleted, provided as a string.
* Executes the command to delete a task from the task list.
* Displays a confirmed message after successful deletion.
* @param tasks The task list from which the task will be deleted.
* @throws ClippyException If the index is invalid (e.g., out of bounds or not a number).
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws ClippyException {
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return false, since deleting a task does not end the program.
* Filters tasks in the task list based on a specified date.
* Only tasks that match the given date are displayed.
* Executes the filter command by displaying tasks that match the given date.
* @param tasks The task list to filter.
* @throws ClippyException If the date format is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws ClippyException {
private LocalDate parseDate(String input) throws ClippyException {
* Represents a command that searches for tasks containing a specified keyword in their description.
* The search is case-insensitive and matches partial words.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the command to find and display tasks that match the given keyword.
* @param tasks The task list to search within.
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return false, since finding a task does not end the program.
* Represents a command to display all tasks in the task list.
* The command retrieves the list of tasks and prints them to the user.
* Executes the command to display all tasks currently stored in the task list.
* The tasks are formatted and displayed using the UI component.
* @param tasks The task list containing the tasks to be displayed.
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return false, since listing tasks does not end the program.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* The command updates the specified task's status and displays a confirmed message.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param indexStr The index of the task to be marked as done, provided as a string.
* Executes the command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Displays a confirmation message after successful marking.
* @param tasks The task list containing the task to be marked as done.
* @throws ClippyException If the index is invalid (e.g., out of bounds or not a number).
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws ClippyException {
* Determines whether this command should cause the program to exit.
* @return false, since marking a task does not end the program.
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the task list.
* The command updates the specified task's status and displays a confirmed message.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param indexStr The index of the task to be unmarked as not done, provided as a string.
* Executes the command to unmark a task as not done in the task list.
* Displays a confirmation message after successful unmarking.
* @param tasks The task list containing the task to be unmarked.
* @throws ClippyException If the index is invalid (e.g., out of bounds or not a number).
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws ClippyException {

* @return false, since unmarking a task does not end the program.

* @throws ClippyException If the input does not match any valid command format.
public static Command parse(String input) throws ClippyException {
